text: I'm Nicholas Kristof of the New York
Times in january i announced a win a
trip contest to choose a student to come
with me on a reporting trip to Africa a
college students do you want to win an
all-expense-paid vacation plus travel to
tourist hotspots a warm welcome by
hospitable local people now I have a
winner meet Paul bowers from the
University of South Carolina Paul
congratulations thank you y'all ready
for an Africa trip I think so so tell us
a little bit about yourself well my name
is Paul I write for the daily gamecock
which is the student newspaper at the
University of South Carolina it's my
second year there and honestly I don't
know why this guy picked me hey you were
the best candidate I pick Paul partly
because he I thought he could really
effectively communicate to other
students he has a great record of
writing in the University he goes
blogging and knows video he submitted a
terrific video to YouTube as part of the
application process I don't claim to be
some great humanitarian or intrepid
adventurer it's just that I want to keep
exploring this world and hearing its
people's stories and I want to do those
stories justice basically I want
somebody who can go out there and
connect our trip in West Africa to
American college students and I think
this guy will do it shucks yo y'all
ready for for a good trip in sure all
ready for all those shots I can take it
okay well we're ready to go so keep
following us look out for the trip and
look out for disguise blogs and vlogs
you
